column1: #text=Opuntia ficus-indica is a species of cactus that has long been a domesticated crop plant important in agricultural economies throughout arid and semiarid parts of the world . It is thought to possibly be native to Mexico . [ 1 ] Some of the common English names for the plant and its fruit are Indian fig opuntia , barbary fig , cactus pear , spineless cactus , and prickly pear , although this last name has also been applied to other less common Opuntia species
